name: Zigeunersalat or Gypsy Salad
author: Patricia J
summary: I'm not a Swiss national, but have visited Switzerland.   This is a salad that I enjoyed very much and was able to duplicate.
ingredients: ¼ pound salami, cut into strips
½ pound Swiss cheese, cut into strips
½ cup sliced sweet gherkin pickles
1 (10 ounce) package mixed salad greens, rinsed and dried
directions: Place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water
Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat
Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes
Remove from hot water, cool, peel and cut into quarters
Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil
Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes
In a medium bowl, toss together the potatoes, peas, salami, cheese, gherkins and French dressing until evenly coated
Line a large, shallow bowl with salad greens and top with the salad mixture
Garnish with the hard boiled eggs and anchovies
